description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Number of new full-time equivalent jobs created for women 15+ years old
Number of new full-time equivalent jobs created for men 15+ years old
Total number of new full-time equivalent jobs created
Number of additional females benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
Number of additional males benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
Number of additional people benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
Extent to which policies, systems and/or institutional measures are in place at the national and sub-national levels to generate and strengthen employment and livelihoods
Number of additional demonstration schemes which expand and diversify the productive base, based on the use of sustainable production technologies
Number of additional advocacy and knowledge schemes which expand and diversify the productive base, based on the use of sustainable production technologies
Number of additional skill-building schemes which expand and diversify the productive base, based on the use of sustainable production technologies
Number of additional implementation support schemes which expand and diversify the productive base, based on the use of sustainable production technologies
Total number of people with improved access to energy as a result of UNDP-supported intervention
percentage of households benefitting from improved energy access which are female headed households

description.narrative: % de décès prévus notifiés dans les préfectures de Nzérékoré et Macenta % de décès testés et enterrés de manière digne et sécurisée en moins de 24 h après réception de l’alerte Nombre de TDR et EDS réalisés Nb de leaders communautaires formés sur la promotion de l'hygiène et de l'enterrement digne et sécurisé dans les préfectures de Nzérékoré et Macenta % de collectivités disposant d’un pré-positionnement de kits de protection communautaire Nombre de CTE entièrement équipés en mesure de traiter les cas d'Ebola jusqu'au 02 Juin Nombre de centres capables d’accueillir des patients suspects Ebola 24/7 Nombre de CTEPI fonctionnels avec du personnel formé % des patients suspects Ebola pris en charge au niveau CTE puis CTEPI à compter du 1er juillet % d’intrants et d’équipements identifiés sur le CTE transférés au CTEPI Nombre d'employés du CTEPI correctement formés % de patients guéris d’Ebola et familles ayant bénéficié d’un suivi clinique à la fin du projet sur la zone d’intervention % de patients dans le besoin de spécialistes ou d’examens paracliniques complémentaires référés Nombre d’agents sanitaires du Ministère de la Santé correctement formés et actifs dans la surveillance épidémiologique dans les préfectures de Nzérékoré et Lola

comment.narrative: La résurgence de la MVE à Koropara a mis en avant des carences au niveau de la détection, et de la prise en charge des malades notamment dues à la mauvaise compréhension par les communautés de la maladie et aux réticences des populations par rapport à la prise en charge. Les structures sanitaires au démarrage du projet ne sont également pas adéquates pour la prise en charge de malades de d'infections à potentiel épidémique, le projet va promouvoir la mise en oeuvre des CTEPI pour la prise en charge future des cas de maladies à potentiel épidémique.

title.narrative: Appui à l'État dans sa préparation et sa réponse contre l'épidémie de fièvre Ebola

description.narrative: Appui à l'État dans sa préparation à la riposte contre la maladie à virus Ebola. L'objectif général du Plan est d'organiser la planification et la coordination de la lutte, d'informer la population du risque d'épidémie et des mesures préventives à observer, de renforcer la surveillance épidémiologique, de promouvoir la prévention de la transmission, et de renforcer les capacités de réponse du système national de santé
Améliorer la capacité de préparation nationale post-Ebola à répondre efficacement aux futures épidémies de santé

Fourniture Internet et cablage de deux bureaux des direction de l'ANSS et DNE

title.narrative: Appui à l'État dans sa préparation et sa réponse contre l'épidémie de fièvre Ebola

description.narrative: Appui à l'État dans sa préparation à la riposte contre la maladie à virus Ebola. L'objectif général du Plan est d'organiser la planification et la coordination de la lutte, d'informer la population du risque d'épidémie et des mesures préventives à observer, de renforcer la surveillance épidémiologique, de promouvoir la prévention de la transmission, et de renforcer les capacités de réponse du système national de santé

Disbursement

This project will be focussed on addressing key gaps highlighted by country teams in the priority countries which Oxfam could support. The HECA regional platform will work with the priority country teams to ensure a coherent approach in both Ebola spreadprevention and equipping of teams for response in the event there is an outbreak in their respective countries. Key preparedness activities will include building staff capacity on community engagement and Ebola response actions, developing community engagement plans with communities in high risk locations, conducting of simulation exercises, conducting assessments for and supporting installation of WASH facilities in identified ETCs, preparing of contingency stock and coordination with local and nationalstructures on Ebola preparedness. The following are the proposed activities per country: Uganda i) Conducting of community engagement activities including vulnerability assessments, community mobilisation and awareness creation (using dialogue meetings, radio shows, working with village health workers) on Ebola prevention and preparedness for approximately 28,711 people in five zones in Kyaka settlement. ii) Assessment and establishing of WASH emergency response kits for 10 treatment facilities including handwashing facilities and disinfection kits iii) Development and production of IEC material for Ebola awareness iv) Training and capacity building of approximately 20 Oxfam and partner staff v) Procurement of personal protection equipment for 10 Oxfam staff operating at the reception centre and contingency stock for Ebola response vi) Conducting of a technical review of the Ebola preparedness and response plan to inform updates in the national EVD preparedness plan. This includes supporting 2 EVD district coordination meetings

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

title.narrative: Beat Ebola By Building Accountability in Liberia

description.narrative: Liberia is recovering from the worst Ebola outbreak of all time. We are working with thousands of Liberians in some of the poorest communities in the country and need your help to make sure a health crisis like this never happens again. For many years we've worked on the ground through our Community Justice Teams (CJTs) to build the trust and accountability that is critical to improve lives-- now help us to scale up the CJTs and build a better future for Liberia.

mailing-address.narrative: Jean Scrimgeour, 1110 Vermont Ave NW, Suite 500, Washington, District of Columbia 20005, United States

title.narrative: Supporting Nutrition and Ebola Response Preparedness in Malawi through UNICEF

description.narrative: This activity (Supporting Nutrition and Ebola Response Preparedness in Malawi through UNICEF) is a component of Malawi Health Sector Support Programme reported by DFID, with a funding type of 'Multilateral organisation' and a budget of £4,878,419. This component benefits Malawi, and works in the following sector(s): Basic nutrition. , with the following implementing partners: United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF). The start date is 15-08-2017 and the end date is 31-10-2019.

title.narrative: Help Care For Ebola Orphans in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: This project helps take care of 3 children who are too old to be adopted but lost both parents during the Ebola epidemic in Sierra Leone. The support they receive includes food, clothing, school-related expenses, and psycho-social support/counseling. The kids are encouraged to dream again and taught that they can be and do anything by giving them a bright future, ensuring they do not have undesirable lifestyles.

mailing-address.narrative: Sylvester Renner, 1906 Knob Creek Road, Suite 3, Johnson City, Tennessee 37604, United States

title.narrative: Stop Ebola: What you can do

description.narrative: *See reports for most recent updates* In response to the ongoing Ebola epidemic, this project will train BRAC's all-female frontline force of 400 community health promoters to stop the spread of the virus in remote communities in Sierra Leone. These women, trained by BRAC, are known in their own communities and are going door to door, educating people on how to prevent Ebola and recognize symptoms. But they need funding to pay for flyers and leaflets, food and travel costs, and disinfectant.

mailing-address.narrative: Walid Sghari, 110 William Street, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10038, United States

title.narrative: Help Us Stop the Ebola Crisis in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: Health officials say the Ebola outbreak, centered in West Africa, is the deadliest ever with over 1,093 infected and almost 500 of those from Sierra Leone. Greatest Goal Ministries operates a free outpatient hospital in Lakka. The military has set up Ebola isolation tents directly outside the doors of our hospital. This project will provide the desperately needed supplies and protective clothing for health care workers as well as support information materials needed for the community.

mailing-address.narrative: Carolynn (Lynn) Pelton, 3410 126 Ave. NE, Bellevue, WA 98005, United States

title.narrative: Help MSF Battle the Ebola Outbreak in West Africa

description.narrative: As the Ebola outbreak continues to spread, with 1,093 cases and 660 deaths now reported across west Africa, Doctors Without Borders/Medecins Sans Frontieres (MSF) is stepping up its response in the most affected areas.

mailing-address.narrative: Corporate Donations, 333 Seventh Avenue, 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10001, United States

description.narrative: From December 2013 to January 2016, Liberia, Sierra Leone, and Guinea experienced the most lethal Ebola outbreak on record. It was the first large-scale outbreak of the virus in the region and communities are still recovering from the epidemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Britt Lake, 1110 Vermont Ave Suite 550, Washington, D.C. 20005, United States

description.narrative: Liberia suffered the worst outbreak of Ebola in recorded history. Accurate information is one of the primary ways to slow and ultimately stop the spread of this horrible disease. Donate now and help us continue to support grassroots organizations to mobilize, educate and bring accurate information into their communities to prevent the further spread of the Ebola Virus. Local communities have been the first responders so let's continue to help them keep their communities safe by supporting them!

mailing-address.narrative: Williametta Saydee-Tarr, Doe's Apartment Building, 2nd Floor Suites, Congo Town, Monrovia, Montserrado Liberia

title.narrative: Info Saves Lives: Ebola Outbreak in West Africa

description.narrative: The deadly Ebola outbreak in West Africa - the worst in recorded history - has so far claimed more than 7,800 lives. At Internews, we believe that during a public health emergency like this one, people need quick, free and reliable information about the disease and how to prevent it. Please help us to ensure that communities at risk, and especially those living in remote rural areas, get the right information now: how to identify early symptoms, prevent transmission, what to do and where to go.

mailing-address.narrative: Amanda Frankel, 1640 Rhode Island Ave NW, Suite 700, Washington, DC 95518, United States

title.narrative: Responding to the Ebola Outbreak in West Africa

description.narrative: International Medical Corps is currently in Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Liberia, Mali and Sierra Leone, and is one of a handful of international NGOs that is treating Ebola patients in West Africa. The WHO has reported over 27,500 cases and 11,200 deaths across West Africa. We are committed to getting to zero cases, and to rebuilding and strengthening the local and regional health systems; engaging community members in recovery through outreach and education programs; and bolstering preparedness.

mailing-address.narrative: Davis Nordeen, 12400 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90025, United States

title.narrative: Keeping Kakata Liberia Safe From Ebola

description.narrative: When the local hospital closed and the government shutdown in July, our clinic was overwhelmed. Other health workers in Kakata ran away, but our staff stayed and continued the work. Since that time, as the hospital has reopened and closed a number of times, we have continued to build for the future. We have laid the foundation for a new Medical Center. With the help of a grant from Global Giving, we just recruited 10 new Community Health Workers bringing our total to 20. Looking ahead.

mailing-address.narrative: Nanci Cole, 2515 Park Place, Colorado Springs, CO 80904, United States

title.narrative: After Ebola, Gardens Help Rebuild Lives

description.narrative: In a country where so many already lived on less than $2 a day, Ebola's truly crippling longer-term impact is on the whole population's ability to earn a livelihood and feed their families. The epidemic has caused missed planting and harvesting seasons, price spikes, and food shortages. Working with three in-country partners to reach those most isolated by poverty and disease, we are providing more than 25,000 packets of tested, appropriate vegetable seeds, along with support and training.

mailing-address.narrative: Peter Marks, PO Box 9163, Asheville, NC 28815, United States

title.narrative: Lifesaving Information: Halting Ebola in Liberia

description.narrative: The deadliest Ebola outbreak in history has already claimed almost 7,000 lives in West Africa - 70% have been women. Accurate and timely information for public health campaigns is a key to halting the spread of the virus. Through the distribution of our solar and wind-up emergency radios, people living in isolated areas will be able to access information 24/7 to combat rumor and misinformation and learn facts on how to protect themselves and what to do if they suspect someone is infected.

mailing-address.narrative: Kristine Pearson, 76 Arnold Street, Observatory, Cape Town, South Africa 7925, South Africa

title.narrative: Prevent the spread of Ebola in West Point, Liberia

description.narrative: The most densely populated slum in the Republic of Liberia, West Point is home to an estimated 60,000 women, men and children. A single confirmed case of Ebola could be completely devastating to the entire community. Preventing the spread of the disease from the remaining population would be extremely difficult.

organisation.narrative: West Point Women for Health and Development Org.

mailing-address.narrative: Nelly Cooper, Township of West Point, West Point Women's Center ,near the football field., Monrovia, none 1000-10, Liberia

title.narrative: Protect Ebola Healthcare Workers in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: Keep healthcare workers in Ebola-stricken areas of Sierra Leone, Africa protected from the disease by providing gloves, gowns, masks, goggles and disinfectant to the clinics and hospitals where they're needed most.

mailing-address.narrative: Angela Garcia, 700 Trumbull Drive, Pittsburgh, PA 15205, United States

description.narrative: The Ebola Rural Community Awareness Raising Project is designed to mitigate the spread of the deadly Ebola disease in 75 village communities, this will be done by strengthening and building the capacity of community health structures (Community Health clubs) to help disseminate EBOLA sensitization massages from village to village using IEC materials. It is expected that at the end of this project, communities would be able to manage their own community preventive health problems.

organisation.narrative: Future In Our Hands, Sierra Leone

mailing-address.narrative: Alpha S Kargbo, 20 Lunsar Road, 7 agriculture road Kabala, Makeni, Northern Province PMB430, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: disseminaion of true info on Ebola virus in Abuja

description.narrative: GIFORD plans to sensitize the six area councils of Abuja of about 1,405,201 people on the realities and basic facts of Ebola Virus.

mailing-address.narrative: PRISCILLA NWOKENNA, B522 SEROB LEGACY HOTEL RD BEHIND DUNAMIS CHURCH AREA 1 GARKI, ABUJA, CATHOLIC PRO-CATHEDREAL AREA 3 GARKI , ABUJA, FCT, ABUJA 900001, Nigeria

title.narrative: Using Video Education to Avoid Getting Ebola

description.narrative: Proper information is keen in enabling people to avoid contracting the deadly Ebola Virus, so providing the easily understandable messages to the people will help to stop the outbreak. We will use video Education in local languages to conduct interpersonal awareness on how to prevent getting the deadly viral disease using with mobile projectors.

mailing-address.narrative: E. Orlind Cooper, Monrovia Christian Revival Church Building, 13th Street, Cheeseman Avenue, Sinkor, Monrovia, Montserrado 1000-10, Liberia

description.narrative: PAAJAF Foundation believes that with awareness creation with regards to the Ebola outbreak in West Africa it can help reduce the high risk of acquisition in neighbouring countries like Ghana where record of Ebola virus is not at all/minimal. PAAJAF works with deprived and underprivileged communities, children, women and families in Ghana and our awareness creation on Ebola will go a very long way to fight EVD acquisition.

mailing-address.narrative: Aruna Rao, P.O. Box ML657, Mallam-Accra, Greater Accra ML 657, Ghana

description.narrative: The Coalition to End Ebola is a group of government, community, and NGO partners working together in Liberia to end the Ebola epidemic and stop the spread of the virus. The objectives of the coalition are simple: to provide information to communities about Ebola and coach them on prevention, identify the sick, treat the ill, bury the dead, reintegrate survivors, and support the families of the affected.

mailing-address.narrative: Katie Meyler, P.O. Box 438, Bernardsville, NJ 07924, United States

description.narrative: In West Africa, textiles have traditionally served as a medium of communication, and a method of storytelling. GAIA VF has successfully developed a fabric design to promote knowledge of HPV and cervical cancer. We are now working on distributing a cloth design that would help health workers educate the population about Ebola symptoms and how to protect against the virus' spread. The cloth will be distributed to health workers in Ebola-affected countries, and used to raise awareness.

mailing-address.narrative: GAIA Vaccine Foundation, 146 Clifford St, Providence, RI 02903, United States

title.narrative: Fighting The Outbreak of Ebola in Liberia

description.narrative: Liberia, Guinea, Sierra Leone, and Nigeria are currently experiencing the most serious and widespread Ebola outbreak that history can record. The outbreak of this virus is claiming more and more lives on a daily basis. Communities are struggling to contain the virus and control the epidemic. VAAFD will help disseminate vital sanitation and medical supplies to clinics communities across Liberia, educate people on how to stop and contain the outbreak and support families of those in quarantine.

mailing-address.narrative: Karrus Hayes, PO Box 855 Paynesville, Bssa Town, 1001 Monrovia 10, NA Liberia

title.narrative: Ebola Prevention & Support for Women in Detention

description.narrative: The Ebola epidemic continues to affect West Africa with over 10,000 deaths & more than 24,000 infected. In Sierra Leone, the disease is devastating the country with a broken health system, lockdowns, curfews, closed schools & businesses. Everyone is affected. AdvocAid is providing welfare support to women in detention, vital legal aid to those affected by the State of Emergency as well as supplying women's prisons, police stations and courts with donations of sanitation materials.

mailing-address.narrative: Simitie Lavaly, 39 Upper Brook Street, Freetown, Western Region None, Sierra Leone

description.narrative: Since March, the Global Communities team in Liberia has been delivering outreach messages on preventative hygiene practices to an at-risk population of 366,000 people, placing an emphasis on women, who are disproportionately affected by Ebola due to their role as family caretakers and health workers. We are also providing local burial teams with supplies and training on safe and effective burial techniques that will reduce further spreading of the virus.

mailing-address.narrative: Kate Duis, 8601 Georgia Ave, Suite 800, Ste 800, Silver Spring, MD 20910, United States

description.narrative: The ISurvivedEbola Campaign is a transmedia project that mobilizes Ebola survivors from Guinea, Liberia, and Sierra Leone to share stories of recovery to inform the West African general public about the virus and how they can protect themselves and their communities from it, reduce stigmatization, and promote reintegration of Ebola survivors.

mailing-address.narrative: Anthony Scala, 777 United Nations Plaza 5th Floor, 5th Floor, New York, New York 10017, United States

description.narrative: The Ebola outbreak in West Africa is the worst in history and continues to sicken and kill thousands of people in Liberia, Sierra Leone, and Guinea. As the outbreak advances and devastates already weak health systems, Partners In Health is leading a response effort along with partners on the ground that will deliver care, help contain the current outbreak, and strengthen health systems for the long term.

mailing-address.narrative: Laura Soucy, 888 Commonwealth Avenue, 3rd Floor, Boston, MA 02215, United States

title.narrative: Help Children Survive the Ebola Outbreak

description.narrative: Save the Children is on the ground working with health ministries in Liberia, Sierra Leone and Guinea to address the outbreak in many ways. We are currently training teachers, health workers, nurses and local organizations on prevention measures against Ebola and are distributing protective kits and essential medical equipment. We are dedicated to ensuring that we reach people in hard-to-access locations, particularly children. Donate now to support our efforts.

mailing-address.narrative: Penelope Crump, 501 Kings Highway E., Suite 400, Fairfield, CT 06825, United States

title.narrative: Ebola Emergency: Help WFPUSA prevent a food crisis

description.narrative: The Ebola epidemic can quickly become food crisis. Hundreds of families in West Africa have already lost someone to the virus.To contain Ebola, families are quarantined, many unable to leave their homes for weeks. As a result, farmers cannot tend to their crops and livestock. This means that a year's harvest can literally be left to rot in the field. That's why WFP has been on the ground since last March providing emergency humanitarian relief to families caught up in the epidemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Erin Wiegert, 1725 I Street NW, Suite 510, Washington, DC 20006, United States

title.narrative: Global Aid Needed to Stop Ebola Outbreak in Africa

description.narrative: WHO has declared this epidemic an international emergency. It's not too late to help meet the critical needs of our partners and their communities that have been impacted by the Ebola virus in Sierra Leone, Liberia and Guinea. World Harvest develops a proposal "Emergency Disaster Relief and Community Awareness and Sensitization on the Prevention & Precautions of the Ebola Epidemic Disease" to significantly enhance, educate and capacitate the local communities. We will be doing mission outrea

mailing-address.narrative: Ferry Kristianto, 147 W Palm Ave, Monrovia, CA 91016, United States

title.narrative: Psycho Social support for Ebola victims

description.narrative: IsraAID in partnership with the first lady in Sierra Leone will conduct a 2 year training program that will focus on MHPSS- (Mental Health Psycho-Social Support) with the aim of building a national network of service providers.

mailing-address.narrative: Navonel (Voni) Glick, Be'er Sheva POB 10300 Postal 84002, Negev Institute, Leonardo Hotel 9th Floor, Room 904, Henriyeta Sold 4 Be'er Sheva 84894, Be'er Sheva, Be'er Sheva 10300, Israel

title.narrative: Help prevent Ebola in Ghana-West Africa

description.narrative: The Anidaso Nsae Foundation (TANF) believes that we can help raise awareness of Ebola in West Africa to hopefully reduce the high risk of outbreak reaching neighbouring countries, like Ghana. TANF works closely alongside the youth community. We are going to train and educate our young people on Ebola, so that they can spread the word and their knowledge of the virus in local communities. To make this possible we need funding to pay for flyers and leaflets,T.shirts food and travel costs etc.

mailing-address.narrative: Laud Kwaku Akuffo, Oyarifa-Teiman, P.O.BOX CT 9853 CANTONMENT, Accra, G/Accra 00233, Ghana

description.narrative: To date, officials are reporting nearly 10,000 deaths in West Africa due to this horrific virus. With the death toll rising, MAP International continues to respond to the largest and most deadly Ebola outbreak in history by providing infectious disease protection suits and supplies to protect those treating the infected.

mailing-address.narrative: Katie Pace, 4700 Glynco Parkway, Brunswick, GA 31525, United States

title.narrative: Smart phones for 100 Ebola health workers

description.narrative: Aid organizations fighting Ebola desperately need faster access to data from the field. Journey has built an app for health workers and volunteers, which saves time and provides decision makers with instant access to data. Already, 20 phones have been purchased for two NGOs in West Africa, which are already running the app. The project aims to give another 100 health workers low-end Android phones, with the app installed.

mailing-address.narrative: Britt Lake, 1023 15th Street NW, 12th Floor, Washington, D.C. 20005, United States

title.narrative: Stop Ebola: UNICEF Responds to a Region in Crisis

description.narrative: The Ebola outbreak in West Africa is the deadliest in history. More than 10,000 cases have been reported since March, and nearly 5,000 people have died, with children being Ebola's most vulnerable victims. We can stop Ebola. UNICEF is at work on the ground across West Africa - airlifting supplies, training health workers and caring for children and their families. With early treatment, children and their families can survive this disease. Help UNICEF stop Ebola.

mailing-address.narrative: Emma Pfister, 125 Maiden Lane, New York, New York 10038, United States

title.narrative: Ambulance for Liberian Villages Impacted By Ebola

description.narrative: Liberians are dying every single day because of its failing health infrastructure. Ambulances are needed as the country had just 10 when the outbreak first started. Some people call more than 30 times before getting an ambulance to them to get medical treatment for Ebola. We want to get Liberians in rural villages an ambulance now so that we can save as many lives as possible. No one should have to die waiting for an ambulance.

mailing-address.narrative: Tricia Wagga, P. O. Box 241, Bear, DE 19701, United States

title.narrative: Prevention & support for orphans of ebola victims

description.narrative: Liberia, Sierra Leone, and Guinea are experiencing the most lethal Ebola outbreak on record. This is the first large scale outbreak of the virus in the region and communities are struggling to contain the epidemic. Hundreds of parents are been killed and their children are orphans without cares.

mailing-address.narrative: Joseph Awuru, N0 4a Foday Kabah Way, Latrkunda Sabiji, Serekunda, Banjul, West Africa PMB 265 Serekunda, Gambia, The

title.narrative: Reintergrate 50 Female Ebola Survivors in Liberia

description.narrative: This project will help 50 female Ebola survivors and women affected by the disease in two of the hardest hit communities near Monrovia overcome post Ebola trauma, stigmatization, discrimination and social economic gaps. This will includes psychosocial counseling support, public education against stigmatization, survivors' reintegration community dialogues and provision of start-up reintegration and recovery assistance to survivors,

mailing-address.narrative: Marian Deah, One Gurley Building, Mechlin Street, Monrovia,, 231, Liberia

description.narrative: Eight nurses in Liberia are working to stem the tide of the Ebola epidemic by providing critical community-based education. Three have partnered with over 30 churches and mosques, others have gone door-to-door or trained peer educators. Each of them has disseminated lifesaving information about EVD's prevention, transmission, and management. They also distribute buckets and chlorine-based solution so community members can follow guidelines for proper sanitation and Ebola prevention.

mailing-address.narrative: Laura Ridge, 110 Reade Street #5, New York, NY 10013, United States

title.narrative: PROTECT 950,000 ZAMBIAN CHILDREN FROM EBOLA VIRUS

description.narrative: Chikasika Child Care Institution is a Zambian Charitable organization providing basic services to vulnerable children in poor communities in Zambia. Zambia is one of the countries in Africa that is at a very high risk of experiencing an outbreak of Ebola Virus just like what is being experienced in Liberia, Sierra Leone, and Guinea. Communities where the virus has broken out are struggling to contain the epidemic which is the first large scale outbreak of the virus in the region

mailing-address.narrative: Niza Simpungwe, FINDECO HOUSE, 16TH FLOOR, ROOM 19, ZAMBIA, LUSAKA, LUSAKA 10101, Zambia

title.narrative: Healthcare for 500-1000 Ebola Orphans in Liberia

description.narrative: The objective of this project is to provide one year healthcare, nutritional assistance, and education fees and supplies for at least 500 to 1000 children, who have lost their parents due to Ebola.

mailing-address.narrative: Yawo Akrodou, 31 Concord Street Apt 4, Jersey City, New Jersey 07306, United States

title.narrative: Survivors: a portrait of the Ebola crisis

description.narrative: Through the eyes of Sierra Leonean filmmakers, Survivors presents an unforgettable portrait of the Ebola outbreak in West Africa. The team focuses their lens on unfolding stories of Sierra Leonean heroism all around them. Through the courageous stories of local Sierra Leonean nursing staff, volunteers, patients and their families, we see enduring humanity amidst the outbreak. Banker White and Anna Fitch are collaborating with African filmmakers Arthur Pratt and Lansana Mansaray.

mailing-address.narrative: Banker White, 90A Mirabel Ave, San Francisco, CA 94110, United States

title.narrative: Kidsave Sierra Leone Ebola Orphan Relief

description.narrative: Kidsave's program gives children who have lost their parents to the Ebola outbreak an opportunity to once again find a home. Since Kidsave began its programs in Sierra Leone in 2010, 470 forgotten children have been placed in homes. While most of the children were reunited with their biological family members, some were placed with host and foster care families. Furthermore, Kidsave is planning to launch a program for working moms who have reunified with children, would receive a loan.

mailing-address.narrative: Bonnie Williams, 4622 Wisconsin Ave. NW, Suite 202, Washington, DC 20016, United States

title.narrative: Last Mile Health - Urgent Ebola Response Campaign

description.narrative: Over the course of this project, Last Mile Health will recruit, train, manage, supply and pay 300 Community Health Workers and 15 Community Health Worker Clinical Mentors to successfully respond to the Ebola outbreak in southeastern Liberia's most rural communities.

mailing-address.narrative: Tommy Good, PO Box 130122, Boston, MA 02113, United States

title.narrative: Out Run EBOLA: awareness/protection for children

description.narrative: The EBOLA Virus Disease (EVD) has sprinted across West Africa infecting over 20,000 people. Awareness and preventative training is the best way to outrun the epidemic. THINK (Touching Humanity In Need of Kindness) has been working with the Ministry of Gender, Children and Social Protection to raise awareness in communities throughout Liberia.

organisation.narrative: Touching Humanity in Need of Kindness (THINK)

mailing-address.narrative: Georgie Davis, P.O. Box 5806, 1000 Monrovia, 10 Liberia, Monrovia, Liberia 10 Liberia, Liberia

title.narrative: Radios for Sierra Leone: information and Ebola

description.narrative: The deadliest Ebola outbreak in history, which has already claimed more than 8,600 lives in West Africa, is slowly coming under control. However, the need for trusted information for public health campaigns, information and news is still key to halting the spread of the virus, and to help people pick up the pieces of their lives. Through the distribution of our solar and wind-up emergency Polaris radios, people in Sierra Leone will be able to access news and health information 24/7.

mailing-address.narrative: Kristine Pearson, 76 Arnold Street, Observatory, Cape Town, South Africa 7925, South Africa

title.narrative: Ebola Prevention: Making Learning Safe in Liberia

description.narrative: With the Liberian government announcing the reopening of schools following the Ebola outbreak, many families lack the basic resources necessary to send their children to school. Many children cannot attend school due to deaths in the family and/or a severe lack of resources. To buttress the government's efforts to keep every school safe and prepared for future emergencies, the "Learning Safe Project" has been developed to provide immediate assistance to children to return to school.

mailing-address.narrative: Anthony Scala, 777 United Nations Plaza 5th Floor, 5th Floor, New York, New York 10017, United States

title.narrative: WASH: Healthy Safety for children post Ebola

description.narrative: This project will build a new and functioning indoor toilet system with hand-washing stations, septic tank, and a hand pump for safe drinking water that will benefit over 200 children at a local school. Our WASH (Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene) project is in line with the objective of UNICEF to contribute to the realization of children's rights to survival and development by increasing equitable and sustainable access to safe water and basic sanitation, and promote improved hygiene.

mailing-address.narrative: Jassie Senwah, 93 Pierce Ave, Suite 1, Dorchester, MA 02122, United States

title.narrative: Provide housing for 100 Ebola affected orphans

description.narrative: Since the Ebola virus outbreak in 2014, over 4500 children lost their parents and became orphaned. These children are now struggling to find food, shelter, medical care and the support they need to sustain themselves in the proper way. Taking them off the streets is very essential because if we don't they could be exploited in many ways for example the sex trade, child labor, arm robbery, and theft. Upon completion of the girls and boys dorms, we will be able to house 100 orphan children.

mailing-address.narrative: Adolphus Hall, P.O. Box 5512, Johnson City, TN 37602, United States

title.narrative: Communities Fighting Ebola in Urban Sierra Leone

description.narrative: The Welbodi Partnership works in some of the poorest urban neighborhoods of Freetown, many of them very hard hit by the Ebola outbreak. With this project, we will engage with community leaders and the staff of primary health clinics, who often know best what they need to stop the spread of Ebola and reduce its impact in their communities. We will provide funding for the most promising of these ideas, and will help community groups and front line health workers implement these initiatives.

mailing-address.narrative: Ryann Manning, Unit 14, Garrick Industrial Centre, London, NW9 6AQ, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Build a home for Ebola orphans in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: Touch the Nations' orphanage will give children a place to call home after the traumatic death of their parents to Ebola. While we see news of Ebola on television, these children cannot just change the channel to escape the disease and its aftermath. 10-year old Saye lost his mother and sister to the Ebola virus, and no one from his extended family has come to claim him. We want to give children like Saye a home.

mailing-address.narrative: Carrie Theisen, 3406 North 65th St, Omaha, NE 68104, United States

title.narrative: Help Students Catch Up After Ebola

description.narrative: Ebola isn't over yet. After being closed for 7 months, the MTM Academy finally reopened in March, but students are severely behind. In mid-March, a new case of Ebola was confirmed. We know that ALL of our students are safer somewhere they can be monitored with hand-washing stations and access to medical care and psychosocial support.

mailing-address.narrative: Emily Bell, P.O. Box 438, Bernardsville, NJ 07924, United States

title.narrative: Make Motherhood Safe in Ebola-affected Countries

description.narrative: With health systems in parts of West Africa devastated by the Ebola outbreak, 1.1 million pregnant women in the region may have nowhere to turn. Without proper access to prenatal care, emergency obstetric services, and trained healthcare professionals, maternal deaths will rise dramatically. UNFPA, the United Nations Population Fund, is helping by training and deploying midwives, distributing emergency birth kits, and increasing access to family planning.

mailing-address.narrative: Olivia Ryan, 370 Lexington Avenue, Suite 702, New York, NY 10017, United States

title.narrative: Clean water for Ebola affected community schools

description.narrative: This project will install 50 hand washing stations in Ebola affected communities in Port Loko district, Sierra Leone to stop the spread of the Ebola virus among 1,422 school children and 36 teachers in 25 schools.

mailing-address.narrative: Patrick Kamara, 117 Foster Avenue, Sharon Hill, PA 19079, United States

description.narrative: The Ebola virus has orphaned over 10,000 children in Sierra Leone, thereby causing a huge economic burden on the country. These orphans are in dare need of food, shelter, clothing, medical, psychological and other livelihood support and our organization is committed in providing such supports. Our ultimate goal is to help Ebola Orphans rise above stigma, marginalization, hunger and abuse.

mailing-address.narrative: Abraham Akempta, 18788 Marsh Lane, #3122, Dallas, Texas 75287, United States

title.narrative: The kids kitchen: daily meals in the wake of Ebola

description.narrative: The project will build a small kitchen to provide daily meals to the children of the We Are the Future kindergarten and primary school in Freetown, Sierra Leone. These children come from poor fishing communities where families have lost most of their income due to the Ebola outbreak that has devastated the country and its economy.

mailing-address.narrative: Sylvia Costantini, Off Kingston, upon Hull Way, Aberdeen, Freetown, Western Area Urban 00000, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: Help 250 Youth Recover From Ebola in Guinea

description.narrative: Before the outbreak of Ebola in Guinea, 47% of the population was living below the poverty line (CIA, 2015). Since 2014, West Africa has had over 11,000 deaths from Ebola. Five months after Liberia was declared Ebola-free, Guinea is still dealing with newly confirmed cases and over 2,500 deaths (BBC, 2015). MindLeaps has been serving youth in Guinea since 2011. Now, 250 of these youth and their families are in need of humanitarian relief in the town of Kindia.

mailing-address.narrative: Rebecca Davis, 315 West 36th Street, 2nd Floor, New York, New York 10018, United States

title.narrative: Post-Ebola Guinea: Educate & Empower The Youth

description.narrative: On December 29, 2015, Guinea was declared "Ebola-free" by the World Health Organization. The epidemic infected 28,000 people across West Africa, and Guinea lost 2,536 people to the virus. In the aftermath, MindLeaps' services have become more critical than ever. Families need emergency services: nutrition and psychosocial counseling. Youth need to go to school - and stay in school - in order to understand what happened and how to prevent future outbreaks.

mailing-address.narrative: Rebecca Davis, 315 West 36th Street, 2nd Floor, New York, New York 10018, United States

title.narrative: Start Self Help Groups for 200 Women in KaleboLaka

description.narrative: In rural Ethiopia, the most vulnerable members of the community are women and children. While their well-being is specifically targeted by our clean water projects, there is more than can be done to increase the ability of women to play a full role in decision-making and in the economic life. Increasing women's capacity to earn income and giving them knowledge and tools that can increase their self-confidence are powerful ways of improving the status of women and influencing the whole community

mailing-address.narrative: Julie Cole, 125 West Hill Road, Wandsworth, London, SW18 5HN, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Build A New Home for Ebola Orphans in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: The Ebola Crisis left more than 4500 children as orphans. These children lost not only their parents, but also their homes - shelter and a safe place to sleep at night. The current Dream Home orphanage is a rented facility that is not ideal. It is not fenced, is on a hill and has no common dining room area that can seat the 22 kids at the home. Room layout and other options / facilities are not ideal. This project will build or purchase a new home to serve the needs of these young children.

mailing-address.narrative: Sylvester Renner, 1906 Knob Creek Road, Suite 3, Johnson City, Tennessee 37604, United States

title.narrative: UNICEF Burundi - Support for Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) Country Preparedness and Response Plan

description.narrative: This activity (UNICEF Burundi - Support for Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) Country Preparedness and Response Plan) is a component of Ebola Virus Disease Outbreak - UK Response reported by DFID, with a funding type of 'Multilateral organisation' and a budget of £500,000. This component benefits Burundi, and works in the following sector(s): Infectious disease control. , with the following implementing partners: United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF). The start date is 08-05-2019 and the end date is 06-04-2021.

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

This is an outgoing commitment to United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) of £500,000.00

description.narrative: This activity (UNICEF Consortium (Burundi) - Support for Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) Country Preparedness and Response Plan (with IOM and WHO)) is a component of Ebola Virus Disease Outbreak - UK Response reported by DFID, with a funding type of 'Multilateral organisation' and a budget of £1,600,000. This component benefits Burundi, and works in the following sector(s): Infectious disease control. The start date is 24-10-2019 and the end date is 06-04-2021.

description.narrative: This activity (IFRC Appeal (Regional) - Support for Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) Regional Country Preparedness and Response Plans) is a component of Ebola Virus Disease Outbreak - UK Response reported by DFID, with a funding type of 'Multilateral organisation' and a budget of £600,000. This component benefits Burundi, and works in the following sector(s): Infectious disease control. , with the following implementing partners: British Red Cross. The start date is 24-10-2019 and the end date is 06-04-2021.

description.narrative: Health - Social Affairs - Health - policy, planning and administration
This is an outgoing commitment to British Red Cross of £600,000.00
Aid to international organisations
Aid to international organisations

title.narrative: Provide Care for Ebola Orphans in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: It's estimated that over 10,000 children in Sierra Leone, Africa were orphaned by the recent Ebola outbreak. Children of the Nations has undertaken to build a Care Center for up to 50 children orphaned by Ebola, where they will be able to heal and grow in a safe environment. COTN has been caring for orphaned children in Sierra Leone for twenty years. With your help we'll be able to reconnect some of these children with relatives and provide holistic care for those who have lost everything.

mailing-address.narrative: Kyle Donn, P.O. Box 3970, Silverdale, WA 98383, United States

title.narrative: Beyond Ebola Making Handwashing a Habit in Liberia

description.narrative: The Ebola Virus Disease impact on Liberia was devastating and affected every sector of the Liberian Society. A post Ebola recovery plan is important and essential especially for schools in slums and rural parts of Liberia who prior to the Ebola outbreak did not have proper Water and sanitation facilities on campuses. The Beyond Ebola Making Handwashing a Habit in Liberia Project is aimed at improving WASH and Ebola prevention related activities at 20 selected schools in rural communities.

mailing-address.narrative: James Koryor, 1st Floor Sheila Cinema Building, Carey Street, Monrovia, Liberia, Monrovia, 1000, Liberia

title.narrative: Support 300 Ebola Orphans in Sierra Leone E V D

description.narrative: Summary The objective of this project is to give educational support to 300 EVD affected Orphans in Sierra Leone with scholarship and learning materials in six communities within Western Area Rural District (WARD). The purpose of this project is also to contribute to addressing the challenges face by the Ebola school orphans of educational needs in the project communities in rural Freetown in the western area of Sierra Leone.

mailing-address.narrative: Abu Bakkarr Sesay, Mansaray Street, Devil Hole, WARD, Freetown, Wester Area 00232, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: The kids kitchen: daily meals in the wake of Ebola

description.narrative: The project will provide daily meals to the children of the We Are the Future kindergarten and primary school in Freetown, Sierra Leone. These children come from poor fishing communities where families have lost most of their income due to the Ebola outbreak that has devastated the country and its economy.

organisation.narrative: Bread and Water for Africa UK

mailing-address.narrative: Sylvia Costantini, 50 broadway, London, SW1H 0BL, United Kingdom

title.narrative: WeSurvive: Stories of the Ebola Outbreak

description.narrative: WeSurvive: Stories of the Ebola Outbreak is a web-based, oral history database that allows users to access a substantial collection of personal video testimonials from Ebola survivors, their family members, and other community members affected by the 2014 West African Ebola outbreak. We believe it is vital that West Africans contribute directly and significantly to the historical record and deepen both how this catastrophic Ebola outbreak and the region are understood.

mailing-address.narrative: Banker White, 90 Mirabel Ave, San Francisco, CA 94110, United States

title.narrative: Emergency Response to the Ebola Outbreak in DRC

description.narrative: One week after the most recent Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) was declared over, the government confirmed new cases of the deadly virus in North Kivu. International Medical Corps' Emergency Response Team (ERT) was already in DRC responding to the most recent outbreak, in Equateur Province. The ERT is now working in North Kivu with the Ministry of Health to help with infection prevention, monitoring and surveillance, and building local response capacity.

mailing-address.narrative: Kelli Maddock, 12400 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90025, United States

title.narrative: Prevent the spread of Ebola in the DRC

description.narrative: The outbreak of Ebola has now been declared over in Equateur Province in the North-West of Democratic Republic of Congo. However a new outbreak has been discovered in the Beni region of DRC. To date, 33 people have died from the disease. Beni is a much more populated region and is also one of the most conflict affected. The result is that thousands of people are moving within and out of the region, which makes the disease much harder to contain.

mailing-address.narrative: Jake Ampleford, Oxfam House, John Smith Drive, Oxford, Oxfordshire OX4 2JY, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Give Liberian Ebola Orphans a Home and Future

description.narrative: Children's Aid Liberia (CAL) seeks to build and maintain a children's home providing basic needs, sanctuary, security, shelter, food, care, education, love, and hope to the orphans of Liberia who have been impacted by the Ebola crisis and Liberian Civil War, preparing them to be productive and thriving members of society.

mailing-address.narrative: Nelson Dahn, Rehab Community, ELWA, Paynesville City, Monrovia (Paynesville), n/a, Liberia

description.narrative: Awareness Activities; survival/solidarity package distribution; hand washing facilities established

receiver-org.narrative: Adventist Development and Relief Agency International (ADRA International)

title.narrative: Emergency Response to Ebola Virus Outbreak

description.narrative:
On 1 August 2018, the Ministry of Health of the Democratic Republic of the Congo declared a new outbreak of Ebola virus disease in the health zone of Mabalako in North Kivu Province. The province of North Kivu is among the most populated provinces of DR Congo with 8,000,000 inhabitants. It is a province that shares its borders with 4 other provinces of the country (Ituri, South Kivu, Maniema and Tshopo) as well as with Uganda and Rwanda.
The National Minister of Health of the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) has notified WHO, on August 1, 2018, of an outbreak of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD), in the same province of North Kivu

Communication and sensitization messaging on Ebola prevention and protection measures, production and broadcasting of radio & TV programs, establishing and training community health committees, establishing 270 hand washing facilities, and distributing 50 nutritional and survival kits to survivors and their households

title.narrative: Programme de soutien à la stratégie nationale de riposte contre l'épidémie Ebola

description.narrative: Appui à la Guinée dans sa lutte contre l'épidémie Ebola. Le projet consiste à financer le plan national de riposte, notamment par la mise en place d'un nouveau centre de traitement Ebola en Guinée forestière, et à financer la création d'un centre d'expertise Pasteur à Conakry ayant pour objectif de participer à la surveillance et à la recherche sur Ebola et d'autres maladies infectieuses.

title.narrative: Programme de soutien à la stratégie nationale de riposte contre l'épidémie Ebola

description.narrative: Appui à la Guinée dans sa lutte contre l'épidémie Ebola. reporting-org.narrative: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation

description.narrative: "The United Nations Foundation links the work of United Nations agencies with others around the world. This grant would facilitate support to the World Health Organization and possibly other U.N. agencies for technical assistance to governments, field coordinators, health workers, infection prevention and control experts, data managers, and logisticians. The United Nations Foundation is able to respond quickly to needs as they arise among U.N. agencies that are unable to raise funds individually. "

The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation

reporting-org.narrative: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation

description.narrative: "Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team (HOT) applies the principles of open source and open data sharing for humanitarian response and economic development. This grant would support HOT’s work of using satellite imagery to generate detailed and accurate maps of the Ebola-affected region to facilitate the humanitarian response, and for improving data analysis and tasking tools to do so. The HOT technology platform, which has been proven successful in other relief efforts, is currently being deployed in West Africa and would be upgraded with this support. "

participating-org.narrative: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation

description.narrative: "International Medical Corps provides health care training and relief and development programs. This grant would support infrastructure and staffing of Ebola treatment centers in Liberia and Sierra Leone, as well as for cost for transport of supplies such as personal protective equipment. "

participating-org.narrative: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation

description.narrative: "Population Services International (PSI) specializes in health communications and social marketing, particularly through mass communications. This grant would support implementation of an integrated Behavior Change Communication plan that, in collaboration with partners, would support the distribution of Ebola household kits, as well as a broader campaign to reduce panic, increase transmission-mitigating behaviors, and allow medical actors to implement emergency health measures in Ebola-affected countries. "

participating-org.narrative: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation

mailing-address.narrative: "1120 Nineteenth Street, N.W., Suite 600" Washington, DC 20036-3605

description.narrative: "Capital for Good connects donors and grantmakers with effective international and domestic nongovernmental organizations working in the areas of education, health, human liberty, and economic empowerment. Capital for Good, in partnership with Geneva Global, has established an Ebola Crisis Fund. This grant would support the Fund, providing resources for regranting to community-based organizations for awareness raising campaigns and mobilizing community-based volunteers; providing essential supplies such as disinfectant and protective gear; searching for cases, referring sick individuals to medical care and following up with them; and supporting those who have been quarantined by delivering food and basic medical supplies."

participating-org.narrative: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation

description.narrative: "GlobalGiving is a charity fundraising website that gives social entrepreneurs and nonprofits from anywhere in the world a chance to raise the money that they need to improve their communities. This grant provides resources for regranting to community-based organizations for medical supplies to care for those already infected, protective equipment to keep health workers safe, and educational campaigns to inform the public about Ebola and how it spreads. "

participating-org.narrative: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation

provider-org.narrative: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation
The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation

title.narrative: Upgrading Water And Sanitation Systems Incorporating Skills-Based Training And Employment For Youth In Ebola-Affected Slum Communities

description.narrative:
The programme is a response to national priority needs and a request from the Government for UN support in the identified intervention areas. In terms of the design, governance of implementation and benefits are strongly nationally owned. Its overriding objective is the capacity at national and local levels with hands-on, demonstrated capacity of the key stakeholders and beneficiaries to identify and implement training programmes through the use of participatory approaches that engender local ownership. The requirements are much larger than the resources available and it is part of the programme strategy to use these funds as seed money for further resource mobilization.
While the government faces extreme limitations, their commitment to the success to this project will be key. The Monrovia City Corporation, the Liberia Water and Sewage Corporation, and the Ministry of Public Works have been closely involved in problem identification and priority setting. The working time of Government staff which also serve for purposes of training and coaching, will be an important contribution from the counterpart.
The country which is still battling with this unprecedented outbreak cannot be expected that within the span of 12 to 18 months full sustainability can be achieved. The programme intends to develop a second phase which it will be possible to address the sustainability factor with more credibility. Still, it is expected that the results of the intervention will remain, but they will not be ready to continue without outside technical and financial support. Some of the project immediate objectives are also long term by nature.

Output 2.4: 75% of the affected population are provided adequate and appropriate nutritional care and support during emergency period as per core commitments for children (CCC) through effective coordination in the nutrition cluster, and strong collaboration with Health, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH), Food Security, and Child Protection clusters-,which contributes to Nutrition And Emergencies, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: By 2019, the nutritional status of children under five years, adolescent girls, and women of child bearing age improved with special focus on the reduction of chronic malnutrition in children below2 years.
